title: Complete Bidirectional Translation Layer Integration (SAP-009 Enhancement)

context.background: Foundation tools for bidirectional translation layer are complete (Phase 1 of BIDIRECTIONAL_COMMUNICATION.md): intent-router.py, chora-search.py, suggest-next.py, INTENT_PATTERNS.yaml, GLOSSARY.md, user-preferences.yaml.template. These tools enable mutual ergonomics between conversational input and procedural execution. However, integration work (Phase 2-4) remains incomplete - agents don't yet 'just know' how to use these tools as native and second nature. This coordination request establishes governance for completing the integration following proper DDD → BDD → TDD lifecycle.
context.traceability_context: Emerged from exploration of traceability applicability across SAPs. User requested dogfooding approach to prove value and integrate into repo vision/strategy/planning. After initial foundation work, user correctly noted we must 'use our process and including governance and administrative doc updates where appropriate' - hence this coordination request following proper intake protocol.

deliverables: Enhanced SAP-009 protocol-spec.md (Section 9: Bidirectional Translation Layer)
Enhanced SAP-009 awareness-guide.md (Integration patterns for generic agents)
Enhanced root AGENTS.md (tool discovery and usage patterns) - ALREADY COMPLETE
Enhanced domain AGENTS.md files (5 SAPs: 001, 004, 009, 012, 013) with user signal patterns

BDD scenarios validating intent recognition, preference adaptation, pattern learning
acceptance_criteria: Intent recognition accuracy ≥80% on test query set (30+ queries)
Generic agents (Claude, Cursor, etc.) can discover and use tools via documentation alone
Tools gracefully degrade (missing tool → fall back to documented patterns)
User preferences successfully adapt agent behavior across all 100+ config options

Suggestion engine provides context-aware recommendations based on project state
All BDD scenarios pass (intent routing, glossary search, context analysis, preference loading)
CHANGELOG follows semantic versioning (v4.1.2 → v4.1.3 PATCH release)
